Contact: Name and email so that Danny can get in touch with them to offer them a paid psoting
Source: Where you discovered the thing and where the content was extracted from
job-id: a random string of letters (used in job links and analtytics)
logo-link: used for displaying the logo on the jobs pages
work-pattern: this appears in the job description
money is guess: if we don’t know the range
money min: if we know the specific salary (which is rare) enter it here
money-indication:
0   -<0.2    = low
0.2-<0.4    = med-low
0.4-<0.6    = med
0.6-<0.8    = med-high
0.8-1        = high

0unfortunately this must be calculated every time there’s a change in the rank column
show-salary: tick if we KNOW the salary and have PERMISSION to show it
apply-link:
Remove the source from the URL, e.g.

&source=Indeed.com

Here, it tells 2K Hangar 13 that applicants discovereed the job via Indeed instead of UX Brighton.
Uploading to uxbri.org:
1. File > Download as > Comma-seperated values
2. Rename it to "jobs.csv" and  drag it into the _data folder on Github
3. Wait a minute then load the UX Brighton jobs page
